bioghist.p: Rorer Pharmaceuticals, established in 1910, began as a drug repackaging operation. By 1927, when the company was incorporated, it was manufacturing its own pharmaceuticals. In 1949, Rorer introduced Maalox, which became its strongest selling product.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of product batch records (1914-1964) from Rorer Pharmaceuticals. Also included are product logs, batch record logs, laboratory notes, formula notebooks, product catalogs, and miscellaneous company publications. Many of the records relate to Maalox, one of the company's most popular products.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
